intro: Trichodesma welwitschii, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of striking blue or purple flowers. Its botanical classification places it in the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Trichodesma welwitschii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
